item_blurb: Public comments will be heard at 9:00am for items not on the agenda, for no more than 30 minutes. For those unable to attend the early comment period, there may be additional comment time available later in the day. Note: Comments made during the general public comment period regarding matters pending before the Commission do not become part of the official record for those matters.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence

subitem_title: Legislative Report

subitem_title: Filing Fees Increase

subitem_title: 2018 Schedule of Meeting Dates and Locations
subitem_blurb: For discussion and possible action. (VM-SF)

subitem_title: Interagency Agreement
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission authorization to enter into a 3-year Interagency Agreement with San Francisco Bay Conservation and Development Commission to provide personnel services. (SH/MW-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-17-0258 (Tong, Venice, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Application by Yasmine Tong for major remodel and addition to 1-story, 793 sq.ft. single-family home on 4,802 sq.ft. lot, resulting in 2-story, approx. 26-ft. high, 1,454 sq.ft. single-family home with 4 on-site parking spaces at 756 Sunset Ave., Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (SV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-16-1142 (Layton, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Steve and Barbara Layton to remove existing 150 sq.ft. dock float, 20’ x 3’ gangway, and two 12-in. square concrete marina guide piles; and replace with new 96 sq.ft. dock float, 24’ x 3’ gangway, and two 12-in. square concrete marina guide piles; resulting in decrease of 42 sq. feet of water coverage, at 306 The Rialto, Newport Beach, Orange County. (DN-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-16-1113 (Khoshbin’s Landing LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Khoshbin’s Landing LLC to remove 2 existing dock fingers (37’ x 7’ and 27’ x 5’), install new dock finger (8’ x 72’), and reuse and relocate 3 existing 18-in. round marina guide piles, as well as install four 18-in. round marine guide piles associated with commercial dock, resulting in an increase of 182 sq. feet of water coverage to accommodate large vessels at 2801 West Coast Highway, Newport Beach, Orange County. (DN-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-16-0809 (Coast Community College District, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Coast Community College District to construct a public 12’ x 120’ pedestrian bridge over West Coast Hwy connecting Orange Coast College Maritime Training Center and Orange Coast College School of Sailing and Seamanship. The proposed project involves ancillary improvements on both sides of the bridge, including work on bridge footing, elevator shaft, stairway, and elevator and stairway landing, at 1700 West Coast Hwy, Newport Beach, Orange County. (DN-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-17-0226 (Team Haley, LP, Sunset Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Team Haley, LP to reconstruct mixed-use structure resulting in 2,886 sq.ft. structure, including 1,628 sq.ft. first floor commercial space, 1,121 sq.ft. second floor, single residential unit, with 19 on-site parking spaces, on harbor front lot, 16832 Pacific Coast Hwy, Sunset Beach, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-17-0250 (City of Huntington Beach Magnolia Street Bridge)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Huntington Beach to repair Magnolia Street Bridge including replacement of concrete barriers on outside edges of bridge deck, patching of bridge pier walls beneath bridge deck, replacement of rock slope protection back to original design specifications, and replacement of existing retaining walls at top of rock slope protection areas, at Magnolia Street Bridge, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-17-0157 (Brown, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Todd Brown to remodel existing 2-story, 30-ft. tall, approx. 14,000 sq.ft. restaurant to create 2-story, 30-ft. tall, approx. 14,800 sq.ft. mixed-use building with 29 parking spaces on approx. 0.36-acre site, at 4325 Ocean Blvd., Pacific Beach, San Diego, San Diego County. (AL-SD)

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

subitem_title: Application No. 9-15-1931 (Coast Seafoods Company, Humboldt Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Coast Seafoods Co. to continue approx. 234 acres of existing intertidal oyster aquaculture operations and use of 30 existing floating clam cultivation rafts as well as to expand intertidal oyster aquaculture operations into approx. 256 acres of new areas (for a combined total of 490 acres and 30 rafts) in Arcata Bay, Humboldt County. (CT-SF)

subitem_title: CC-0001-17 (San Diego Association of Governments)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Certification by SANDAG for San Dieguito River railroad bridge replacement, double-track extension, and Del Mar Fairgrounds special events rail passenger platform, Cities of Solana Beach and Del Mar, San Diego County. (LS-SF)

subitem_title: CD-0002-17 (Corps of Engineers, Humboldt Co.)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Determination by Corps of Engineers for maintenance dredging of federal navigation channels in Humboldt Bay and Harbor and dredged material disposal at Humboldt Open Ocean Disposal Site, Humboldt County. (LS-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-16-0067-3 (Gaviota Coast Plan). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action for one year on County of Santa Barbara’s request to amend portions of the certified Local Coastal Program, including to amend the text and maps of the Land Use Plan to adopt the Gaviota Coast Plan and to amend the Coastal Zoning Ordinance to adopt new overlay maps to implement the Gaviota Coast Plan. (MW-V)

subitem_title: County of Ventura LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-VNT-16-0069-2 (Phase 2B). Certification Review
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with Executive Director’s determination that action by the County of Ventura, acknowledging receipt, acceptance, and agreement with the Commission’s certification with suggested modifications, is legally adequate. (JP-V)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-VNT-17-0013 (Kancal Properties LLC, Ventura Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Marc Benezra from decision of Ventura County granting permit with conditions to Kancal Properties LLC for demolition of existing 2,208 sq.ft., 25-ft. tall triplex, and construction of new 5,684 sq.ft., 28-ft. tall 2-family home, at 3289 Ocean Dr., Ventura County. (JP-V)

subitem_title: Ventura County Channel Islands Harbor Public Works Plan Notice of Impending Development CIH-NOID-0002-17 (Temporary Office Trailers for Harbor Administrative Staff)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development (NOID) by the Ventura County Harbor Department to install two temporary office trailers and one temporary handicap accessible restroom within an existing parking lot to accommodate Harbor Administrative staff during the approved reconstruction of the Harbor Administrative Building, located north of Murre Way, Channel Islands Harbor, Ventura County. (WH-V)

item_title: W20a & W20b share a single combined staff report

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Long Range Development Amendment No. LRDP-4-UCS-16-0001-1 Part A. Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action on the University of California at Santa Barbara’s request to amend its certified Long Range Development Plan to correct inadvertent text errors and make corrections to the LRDP boundary on applicable LRDP figures to exclude a privately owned parcel, at University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (DV-V)

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Long Range Development Amendment No. LRDP-4-UCS-16-0001-1 Part B. Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action on the University of California at Santa Barbara’s request to amend its certified Long Range Development Plan to incorporate the Coal Oil Point Reserve (COPR) Management Plan into the LRDP, including policy and map revisions, at University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (DV-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public.  For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-VEN-17-0011 (Sattler, Venice, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Mary Jack, et al., of City of Los Angeles permit exemption granted to Joanna and James Sattler for 691 sq.ft. addition and construction of 506 sq.ft. attached garage to 2,396 sq.ft., 2-story single-family home, at 842 Marco Place, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (MA-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-MNB-17-0014 (Manhattan Beach Open Volleyball Tournament)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by William Victor from decision of City of Manhattan Beach granting permit with conditions for 2017 Manhattan Beach Open Volleyball tournament to be held on public beach August 17-20, 2017, south of Manhattan Beach Pier, Manhattan Beach, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-PPL-17-0015 (Los Angeles Department of Water and Power, Pacific Palisades)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by 16974 Sunset Blvd. LLC of City of Los Angeles granting permit to Los Angeles Dept. of Water and Power for installation of temporary 61-ft. high pole top power distribution station in public right-of-way at 16970 Sunset Blvd., Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (CO-LB)

subitem_blurb: Appeal by Robin Rudisill et al of City of Los Angeles permit granted to Fabienne Korchia for demolition of 1-story, single-family home and construction of 3,400 sq.ft., 24-ft. high, 2-story, single-family home with attached 370 sq.ft. 2-car garage, plus one additional on-site parking space, and roof deck with 34-ft. high roof access structure, at 2325 Wilson Ave., Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (SV-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-VEN-17-0018 (Harbaugh & Court, Venice, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Lilian White, Mary Jack, Nancy Wilding, and Sue Kaplan of City of Los Angeles permit granted to Derek Harbaugh and Nathan Court for remodel and addition to 948 sq.ft. 1-story single-family home with detached 198 sq.ft. garage, resulting in 2,482 sq.ft., 2-story, 28-ft. high, single-family home with attached 356 sq.ft. 2-car garage, at 938 Amoroso Place, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (SV-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-VEN-17-0019 (Hohnen, Venice, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Robin Rudisill, et al, of City of Los Angeles permit granted to Juliette Hohnen for conversion of existing 2-story, 1,812 sq.ft. duplex into single-family home and 604 sq.ft. addition at 628 San Juan Ave., Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (MA-LB)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Orange County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public.  For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Huntington Beach LCP Amendment No. 2-16 (LCP-5-HNB-16-0031-1) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by the City of Huntington Beach to amend the certified Implementation Plan (IP) portion of the LCP by making various changes reflected in seven Zoning Text Amendments and one Zoning Map Amendment. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. 1-17 (LCP-5-NPB-17-0010-1) Certification Review
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with Executive Director’s determination that action of City of Newport Beach accepting certification of LCP Amendment No. 1-17with modifications is legally adequate. Amendment No. 1-17 amends the development standards for Commercial Coastal Zoning Districts and changes Table 21.20-2 to indicate that the Maximum Floor Area Limit for CV-LV is 103,470 sq.ft. for the Lido Hotel site at 3300 Newport Blvd., Newport Beach. (AD-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public.  For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CII-17-0031-3 (Poinsettia 61) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90 day time limit for Commission action up to one year on request by City of Carlsbad to redesignate land uses on seven parcels located south of Cassia Road, between the existing western and eastern segments of Poinsettia Lane, and east of Ambrosia Lane, from R-4 and Open Space (OS) to R-8 and OS, and then  rezone the parcels from One family Residential (R-1) and OS to Residential Density Multiple (RD-M) and OS. (EP-SD)

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-17-0032-4 (Cannon Road Agriculture/Open Space Zone) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90 day time limit for Commission action up to one year on request by City of Carlsbad to amend its certified land use plan and implementation plan to add a new Cannon Road Agriculture/Open Space Zone (CRA/OS) to implement Proposition D on two properties located south of Cannon Road within the Carlsbad Ranch Specific Plan area. (EP-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-16-0027-4 (10th Update LDC) Certification Review
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the action by the City of San Diego accepting the Commission’s certification of LCP-6-SAN-16-0027-4 with modifications is legally adequate. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-PEN-17-0028-1 (Peninsula RM Base Zone Height Limit) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60 day time limit for Commission action up to one year on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified implementation Plan to update height limit regulations for RM-zoned properties in the Peninsula LCP segment. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-17-0030-1 (Land Development Code Amendments) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60 day time limit for Commission action up to one year on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Implementation Plan to update various commercial zone regulations. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-17-0239 (Mansukhani, Solana Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Roger and Michelle Mansukhani to remodel existing 2-story, 4,871 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 800 sq.ft. garage on 8,500 sq.ft. bluff top lot, at 475 Pacific Ave, Solana Beach, San Diego County. (SR-SD)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public. For specific information contact the Commission's San Francisco office at (415) 904-5260.

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-17-0016-1-Part C (Zoning Cleanup)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Santa Cruz to amend numerous sections of the LCP’s Implementation Plan to clarify the zoning ordinance, remove obsolete sections and references, and bring the zoning ordinance into compliance with state law is minor. (RM-SC)

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-17-0016-1-Part E (Parking in Setbacks)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Santa Cruz to amend the LCP’s Implementation Plan to allow parking in the front and exterior side yard setbacks to be counted toward a project’s off-street parking requirements is minor. (RM-SC)

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-17-0016-1-Part G (Elimination of FAR)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Santa Cruz to amend the LCP’s Implementation Plan to remove maximum floor area standards in the R-1-10 zoning district is minor. (RM-SC)

subitem_title: County of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SCO-16-0074-2-Part A (Sewage Disposal Systems)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by Santa Cruz County to amend the LCP’s Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to: 1) allow installation of sewage disposal systems on another lot to serve publicly owned facilities, and 2) extend the timeframe that an applicant can reconstruct a structure damaged by fire/calamity from 3 years to 10 years, is minor. (RG-SC)

subitem_title: City of Carmel-by-the-Sea LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CML-17-0041-1 (Commercial and Temporary Uses)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Carmel-by-the-Sea to amend the Implementation Plan’s standards for certain commercial uses in the Commercial Zoning District and to authorize temporary uses on private property. (MW-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. A-3-MCO-04-012 (Wang, Monterey Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by Brandon Shui Ling Wang to merge 2 parcels and construct 2,315-sq.ft. single-family home and associated improvements at 36228 Highway 1, in Kasler Point area of unincorporated Big Sur Coast, Monterey County. (KB-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 3-16-0233 (South San Luis Obispo County Sanitation District (SSLOCSD) Redundancy and Improvements, San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Consideration of findings in support of Commission action in May 10, 2017 for approval of coastal permit for: 1) installation of redundancy (back-up) infrastructure; 2) after-the-fact recognition of prior development done without a permit; 3) minor flood-proofing; and 4) related development at SSLOCSD wastewater treatment plant at 1600 Aloha Place in the unincorporated community of Oceano in San Luis Obispo County. (DR-SC)

subitem_title: Briefing on Klamath River Dam Removal by Yurok Tribal Representatives
Application No. 1-16-0238 (Humboldt County Department of Public Works (DPW)
subitem_blurb: Application of Humboldt County DPW to disallow parking in 2 public parking areas at Mad River Beach County Park from one hour after sunset to sunrise daily and install manually operated gates, boulders, signage, and speed tables on park access road to control vehicular access to parking lots during proposed closure hours, at Mad River Beach County Park, off of Mad River Rd., approx. 3.5 miles northwest of Arcata, Humboldt County. (MBK-A)

subitem_title: Application No.1-16-1110/CC-0003-17 (City of Eureka Martin Slough Restoration)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Eureka to restore and enhance approx. 8000 feet of Martin Slough, its tributaries and associated riparian and wetland habitat including (1) enlarging the Martin Slough channel to allow for greater tidal exchange, (2) replacing several small culverts and old bridges to increase channel capacity and improve habitat, (3) creating several new tidal ponds to provide critical habitat for coho salmon, (4) restoring portions of the adjacent floodplain and riparian areas, and (5) repairing portions of the earthen berm along Swain Slough off of Fairway Drive in Eureka, Humboldt County. (KH-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, Approved with Conditions

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-16-0046-2 (Vacation Rentals and Mobile Vendors) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action for one year on City of Eureka request to amend certified Implementation Plan to establish development standards for vacation dwelling units and off-street mobile vendors, and to allow these uses in certain zoning districts. (CK-A)

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-17-0007-1 (Minor Use Permits & Medical Cannabis Uses) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action for one year on City of Eureka request to amend certified Implementation Plan to establish a minor use permit process; and to establish regulations for various medical cannabis uses and allow medical cannabis uses in certain zoning districts (CK-A)

subitem_title: County of Del Norte LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-DNC-17-0019-1 (Tedsen Land Rezone) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action for one year on County of Del Norte request to amend certified Implementation Plan to rezone a 1.25-acre forested parcel from RCA-1 (General Resource Conservation Area) and RRA-1 (Rural Residential Agriculture, 1 acre minimum lot size) to RCA-2(w) (Designated Resource Conservation Area – wetland), RCA-2(wb) (Designated Resource Conservation Area – wetland buffer), and RRA-1at 600 Tedsen Lane, east of Lake Earl. (CK-A)

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-16-0018-1 (Wireless Telecommunication Facilities)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Eureka to amend certified Implementation Plan to establish regulations and permitting requirements for wireless telecommunication. (CK-A)

subitem_title: City of Trinidad LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-TRN-16-0065-1 (Short Term Rentals)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Trinidad to modify the City of Trinidad certified Implementation Plan provisions regulating short term rentals of residences for transient occupancy. (MBK-A)

subitem_title: County of Mendocino LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-MEN-14-0840-1 (Mendocino Town Plan Update)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the County of Mendocino to update the Mendocino Town Segment of the certified LCP by amending both the certified Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan. (TG-A)
